importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: Kada Scott was reported missing the day after this date, and the stolen Hyundai Accent was seen parked near where her remains were later found.
The vehicle fire incident occurred three days after Scott’s disappearance, and the car was found burned at a junkyard.
The remains were discovered on this date, and the official announcement of Kada Scott’s identity and Keon King’s arrest was made.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: Kada Scott went missing on this date and the stolen car was seen parked that night, linking it to her disappearance.
The vehicle was seen on video and then reported on fire three days later, with the fire occurring between October 4 and October 7.

keyTakeAways: Kada Scott, a 23-year-old woman, was found dead in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school in Philadelphia, with her remains confirmed by DNA testing.

Keon King, a 21-year-old man from Dover, Delaware, has been arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, causing or risking a catastrophe, conspiracy, and possibly homicide related to Scott’s disappearance.
King’s cellphone was located in areas tied to Scott’s disappearance, and video evidence shows the stolen black Hyundai Accent parked near where Scott’s body was found.
The vehicle was reported stolen on October 4 and later found on fire, compacted at a junkyard, with investigators unable to examine it in full.
An anonymous tip led investigators to re-examine the abandoned school site, where they found the remains; a previous tip had failed to locate Scott’s remains.
Prosecutors believe others may have been involved in the case after the initial events, and this remains under investigation.
Kada Scott worked in an assisted living facility and was remembered by her family as a source of kindness and light; her parents expressed heartbreak over her disappearance and death.
King was previously arrested in another kidnapping case, which ended with dropped charges due to lack of witness participation, but he is now facing serious new charges.

namedEntities.name: Kada Scott
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A missing woman who was found deceased behind an abandoned school in Philadelphia; her case drew national attention due to the emotional impact on her family and the high-profile arrest of a suspect.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She is the central figure whose disappearance and subsequent death form the core of the article’s narrative and public interest.

namedEntities.name: Keon King
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A 21-year-old man from Dover, Delaware, arrested and charged with multiple crimes related to Kada Scott’s disappearance and death, including kidnapping, stalking, arson, and conspiracy.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is the primary suspect in the case and the focus of the investigation, arrest, and legal proceedings.

namedEntities.name: District Attorney Larry Krasner
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The Philadelphia district attorney responsible for leading the prosecution of Keon King and announcing that homicide charges are likely.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is the official who made key public statements about the case, including the potential for homicide charges and the legal process being followed properly.

namedEntities.name: Ashley Toczylowski
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A prosecutor who provided detailed updates on the investigation, including cell location data and video evidence.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She is a key figure in the investigative and prosecutorial process, providing specific evidence and context about the case.

namedEntities.name: Black Hyundai Accent
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A stolen vehicle reported to have been seen near Scott’s body and later found on fire in a junkyard.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It serves as a crucial piece of physical evidence linking Keon King to the case and the timeline of Scott’s disappearance.

namedEntities.name: Abandoned school
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A location behind which the remains of Kada Scott were discovered in a shallow grave.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It is the site where the remains were found, making it a key geographic and investigative location in the case.

namedEntities.name: Dover, Delaware
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The hometown of Keon King, where he resides and was previously arrested.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It provides context for King’s background and prior criminal history, including a prior arrest that may connect to his current case.

namedEntities.name: Assisted living facility
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The workplace of Kada Scott, where she worked and was last seen before going missing.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It provides context about her life and daily routine, showing her connection to the community and her professional environment.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The remains of 23-year-old Kada Scott, a woman reported missing after an overnight shift at an assisted living facility, were found in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school in Philadelphia. Authorities say an anonymous tip led them to re-examine the site, where they discovered the remains confirmed by DNA. Keon King, a 21-year-old man from Dover, Delaware, has been arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, conspiracy, and possibly homicide. Evidence includes King’s cellphone being in locations tied to Scott’s disappearance and video footage showing a stolen black Hyundai Accent parked near the site. The vehicle was later found on fire and destroyed at a junkyard. Prosecutors believe others may have been involved and continue to investigate. King, previously arrested in another case with dropped charges, is now facing serious new charges, and District Attorney Larry Krasner has stated that homicide charges are likely pending further legal review.
title: Remains Found Behind Abandoned School Belong to Missing Philadelphia Woman, Kada Scott
